title: Zinedine Zidane sends message to Eden Hazard after Chelsea hero scores first Real Madrid goal
text:
Former Chelsea star Eden Hazard opened his account for Real Madrid (Picture: Getty)

Zinedine Zidane has urged Eden Hazard to kick on after opening his account for Real Madrid in their La Liga victory over Granada on Saturday.

Hazard secured a dream move to Madrid in June, ending a seven-year spell at Stamford Bridge which saw him develop into one of the best players in Europe.

The Belgium international had endured a subdued start to his career at the Bernabeu, failing to score or assist in his opening five games for the Spanish giants.

However, Hazard produced an impressive performance against Granada this weekend, scoring his first Real Madrid goal with a neat lob before setting up Luka Modric later in the game.

Zinedine Zidane hopes Hazard’s goal can kick-start his Real Madrid career (Picture: Getty)

Reacting to Hazard’s display, Zidane said: ‘We need to see Eden like this, playing well and scoring goals.

‘He wanted that, he was happy in the dressing room. We hope it’s the first of many for him.’

Karim Benzema gave Real Madrid an early lead at the Bernabeu before Hazard opening his account for Real just before half-time.

Goals from Modric and James Rodriguez put the game to bed despite Granada threatening to mount a comeback through Darwin Machis and Domingos Duarte.

Real Madrid’s 4-2 win sees them move four points clear at the top of La Liga, with Granada still in second place.

Third-placed Atletico Madrid face Real Valladolid on Sunday, while fourth-placed Barcelona host Sevilla later that day.

Last month, the former Manchester United and England defender Rio Ferdinand claimed Hazard could end up regretting leaving Chelsea.

‘When you go to a new club, especially the size of Real Madrid, you have got to earn the right to be the man that gets the ball, that they look to first as the talisman,’ said Ferdinand.

‘He has got to do something in the training games and in the games itself, to make them want to give him the ball.

‘I’m fearful for him really that he has gone to Real Madrid at the wrong time.

‘This is an ageing side, they are not on the way up and they have not got much spark about them at the moment, and that is going to reflect on him, badly, in the long term.’

Hazard’s former side Chelsea visit Southampton on Sunday.
